staffList.name: Liam
staffList.bio: Originally from Ottawa, Ontario Chelsea admires the abundance of activities and natural beauty of the West. A born professional who has been involved in the beauty industry since she was 14 years old. It was then that she discovered her love for the ever-changing trade.  Chelsea began her West Coast journey in Pender Island, working at a resort spa

staffList.name: Elijah
staffList.bio: Back home in Ontario, Jen decided she wanted to become a massage therapist shortly after finishing her Bachelor of Kinesiology at university which she had started for her love and interest in anatomy and physiology.

staffList.name: Charlotte
staffList.bio: Natalie was born and raised in Hertford, England, and has been skiing from a tiny 18 months old. Ski instructing brought her to Whistler in 2008 and she has been calling Canada home ever since.

staffList.name: Sophia
staffList.bio: Fiona Joined us at the Whistler Day Spa in September 2017 from the Central Coast of New South Wales, Australia. She completed her beauty education at Ella baché college of beauty therapy,

staffList.name: Logan
staffList.bio: From a little town called Provence in the beautiful South of France to Whistler in 2017, Nathalie has come a long way to share her 6 years of beauty therapist experience with her guests at the Whistler Day Spa. She loves the title Beauty therapist as she believes visiting a beautician IS a type of therapy,

services.name: Aroma Treatment
services.description: Aromatherapy is a holistic healing treatment that uses natural plant extracts to promote health and well-being. Sometimes it’s called essential oil therapy. Aromatherapy uses aromatic essential oils medicinally to improve the health of the body, mind, and spirit. It enhances both physical and emotional health.

services.name: Lymphatic Treatment
services.description: Lymphatic drainage is a gentle, rhythmical massage treatment performed by a specially trained lymphatic massage therapist to stimulate the circulation of lymph fluid around the body. This helps to rapidly speed up the removal of wastes and toxins from a sluggish lymphatic system

services.name: Chiropractic Massage
services.description: Chiropractic practice and massage therapy are some of the modalities that belong to the complementary and alternative medicine.

services.name: Nail care
services.description: Care of the fingernails and toenails. Many nail problems are due to poor nail care. Recommendations for maintaining nail health include keeping nails clean and dry to keep bacteria and other infectious organisms from collecting under the nails

services.name: Reflexology
services.description: Reflexology, also known as zone therapy, is an alternative medicine involving application of pressure to the feet and hands with specific thumb, finger, and hand techniques without the use of oil or lotion. It is based on a pseudoscientific[1] system of zones and reflex areas that purportedly reflect an image of the body on the feet and hands, with the premise that such work effects a physical change to the body.

services.name: Skin care
services.description: Skin care is the range of practices that support skin integrity, enhance its appearance and relieve skin conditions. They can include nutrition, avoidance of excessive sun exposure and appropriate use of emollients.

services.name: Skin Treatment
services.description: Skin care is the range of practices that support skin integrity, enhance its appearance and relieve skin conditions. They can include nutrition, avoidance of excessive sun exposure and appropriate use of emollients.

services.name: Aroma care
services.description: The principle of AromaCare is simple, it is a diffuser of essential oils that works with ready-to-use capsules. Each capsule contains a studied blend of organic essential oils and an associated diffusion program. Simply insert the capsule of your choice and then start your personal wellness session of 20 minutes.

services.name: Body massage
services.description: Massage is the manipulation of soft tissues in the body. Massage techniques are commonly applied with hands, fingers, elbows, knees, forearms, feet, or a device. The purpose of massage is generally for the treatment of body stress or pain.
